isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Power Take-Off (PTO) - PTO Assembly

step1.para: Rotate the transfer case in the repair stand so that the output shaft to the PTO is facing UPWARD.
Assemble the PTO components by performing the following steps.

caution.para: The cups must fit securely in the housing bores. Damage to the components can result.

step2.para: Install the bearing cups into the PTO bearing cage housing. This is an interference fit. Freeze the bearing to -65°F (-54°C) and position the two cups into the housing bores (Figure 71).

item.para: If the cups are loose after the cup temperature warms: Replace the housing.

step2.para: Preheat the first bearing cone to 200°F (93°C). Support the shaft and slide the heated cone in place onto the output shaft (Figure 72).
Install the shaft assembly into the housing. Slide the bearing spacer onto the splined end of the shaft.
With the bearing spacer in position, the second bearing cone can be heated to 200°F (93°C) and installed onto the shaft (Figure 73).
Support the shaft and apply a press of 50-60 lbs (23-27 kg) to the bearing cone to set the bearing in place while the bearing cools.
Apply a light film of SAE 50W synthetic lubricant.
Assemble the shift fork to the clutch collar. Install this unit into the bearing cage housing.
Install the push rod into the housing and through the shift fork assembly.
Apply 20-30 lbs (9-14 kg) of pressure to insert the piston into the housing (Figure 74).
Install the cover plate with the O-ring seal in place.
Lightly lubricate all parts with SAE 50W synthetic lubricant.
Install the 1/4-20 screws using Loctite® 242 sealant. Tighten the screws to 10-14 lb-ft (14-19 Nm).
Insert the spring into the housing over the push rod (Figure 75).
Apply a thin film of Loctite® 518 gasket material to the cap surface. Install the cap with the 1/4-20 screws using Loctite® 242 sealant. Tighten the screws to 10-14 lb-ft (14-19 Nm) (Figure 75).
Install the PTO shaft seal into the housing.
Press the seal into position until the seal is seated on the housing.

step1.para: Install the PTO assembly onto the transfer case.
Apply a thin film of Loctite® 518 gasket material to the housing.
Slide the housing onto the output shaft of the transfer case, aligning the splines of the clutch to the shaft.
Install the eight 7/16-inch (11 mm) diameter screws and washers using Loctite® 277 sealant. Tighten the screws to 60-75 lb-ft (81-102 Nm).
Check that the clutch engages and disengages correctly.
Pressure test the PTO shifter for air leakage by performing the following steps.

step2.para: With the correct fitting installed into the air control port, apply a pressure of 80-100 psi (5.5-6.9 bar).

caution.para: Check for external leaks at the cover plate joint and fitting if the pressure decreases more than 5 psi (0.3 bar) in 10 minutes. Leaks can cause component damage.

step2.para: Check for external leaks at the cover plate joint and fitting if the pressure decreases more than 5 psi (0.3 bar) in 10 minutes.

item.para: If the external joints are sealed and the leakage is still more than 5 psi (0.3 bar): Remove the piston and inspect the O-ring and housing bore for damage. Repair parts as necessary.

step1.para: Install the indicator switch. Tighten the switch to 25-30 lb-ft (34-40 Nm) (Figure 76).

item.para: If a switch is not used: Install the special plug and washer used to cap the access hole. Tighten the plug to 25-30 lb-ft (34-40 Nm) (Figure 76).

step1.para: Repeat Steps 1 through 9 for each remaining declutch, PTO or proportional differential lockout assemblies.
